title: consolidating calendars in Calendar
creator: rgathercoal
content:
I have ended up with five different calendars. They all have different names--probably because I really don't understand how Thunderbird organizes things in regard to the rest of the internet. Several people in our household share calendars, to keep track of events, tasks due, and medications.

So how do I consolidate all the entries in all of these calendars? I have tried syncing, but that doesn't seem to work. How can I know that when I enter a soccer schedule on (one of) my calendars, it will end up on the calendar that my wife uses to print out our family weekly schedule?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/144.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;os:Windows11

title: Two email addresses showing same data
creator: d6accE55
content:
I have two Yahoo email addresses 0 d6a.... and den2....

Both are set up in Thunderbird

However, in Thunderbird, both addresses show the email/folder data associated with the den2... address!

No emails for the d6a... address load to Thunderbird.

Separate data appears for each email address on the Yahoo web pages.

title: Missing folders from e mail account
creator: mikedaly696
content: I just today returned to Thunderbird. I successfully inclued my 3 email accounts but two of them only have inbox and trash folders none of other folders such as drafts, spam ,deleted or trash etc. folders. My G-mail has all these folders. Do I need to delete the two accounts with the missing folders and reinstall or is there a setting I need to change. Regards Mike
